chunks.text: Guys, we talked about selectors in CSS and we said that selectors are used to select an element on which style is going to be applied.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Now, what kind of elements can we apply style on and how can we select those elements?
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: For example, element with an id, element with a class, we can target the element by its name.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: And we can also decide that if there is a particular type of element in a particular type of element, then only the styling is applied.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I will explain the rules of applying this styling in this video and will explain selectors to you.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: If you are enjoying this course, then do write Sigma patch OP in the comment section below.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: We have to maintain high energy throughout the course.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I want to give you a heads up that this video is very important.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: This is a very important video of CSS.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So increase your excitement.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Let's go to the computer screen.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Let's roll the intro.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Alright guys, so I have come to my computer screen and the first thing I am going to do is to make a folder of video 17.

chunks.text: So you should not have any tension in that regard.

chunks.text: Now what I am going to do here is a very simple thing.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I will preview it first.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: And I want to make the background of this div red.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Now you will say, why do you want to make the background of this div red?
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Because I want to know how much space this div is taking.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: That's why I want to make it red.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So because I want to make it red, I will simply give the background of this div red.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So I will say, I will put a style tag here.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I will say that the background of the div should be red.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Now this is our property, this is the value.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I will tell you about other properties and values.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: But for now, you understand that this is the property and this is the value.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So what I did here was an element selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So I write here, element selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: And I will comment it here.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So in CSS, comments are written like this.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Here forward slash, star, and then star.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Whatever we write in the middle of forward slash, those are comments in CSS.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So I put a CSS comment that this is an element selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: You will see here that the background of this div has turned red.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: This was our element selector, a very basic selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Now what are the drawbacks of the element selector that I made here?
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: The drawbacks are that the moment I add another div here,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So what will happen, the background of this div will also turn red.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: And it is possible that you do not want to make the background of this div red.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So if you do not want to make the background of this div red,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Then what will you do?
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Definitely you will use some other type of selector here.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: And you will want to use a specific selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So I can say that do one thing,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Where the class is red, only that div should be red.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So I made class is equal to red here.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Now because I have made class is equal to red here,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: You will get to see here,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: If I write here dot red,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: And after this, if I make the background color red,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Suppose I comment this out,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I do not want all the divs to turn red.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So I will show you here that only this div will be red.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: As you can see here.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So that's why I used class selector here.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So this is our class selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I will write here class selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: After this, the next selector I am going to tell you is id selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: And you must have guessed it as soon as you heard id selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Let us say I want the id of the red hashtag,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Or let's do one thing,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Let's make an id with the name hashtag green.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: And if I write here background color green,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So wherever I will give id green, it will be green.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Now you can see here that our I am another div,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: It has no color, no background color.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: But as soon as I give it id green, I will show you.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I will write here,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I will give id to this only.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Green, and you can see that
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I have given background color green in the id name green.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Its background color will be green.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So this is our id selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: It was very simple, right?
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Yes, it is simple. We make things simple.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Now I will tell you what is child selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: And the source code,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: This will work for your notes.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So what is child selector?
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: If I want the paragraph in a div to turn blue,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So I say the color of the paragraph in the div
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: should be blue and
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: what should be the background color?
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: The background color should be brown.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Okay, let's say I want this.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So if I put a paragraph in any div,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I am a para inside div.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Okay, so what will happen?
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: This selector will be applied, child selector.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Because this is the child of div.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: This paragraph is the child of div.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: And I have said that
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: if any paragraph of div is a child,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: then what will happen?
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: So its background will be brown
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: and blue.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: As simple as that.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Now I will show you one thing.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: If I wrap this whole thing in a div.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Actually I will span this.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I will not do div.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I will put it in main or any other element.

chunks.text: Let's say I use
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: article tag here.

chunks.text: So now this paragraph is not in div.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Now this paragraph is in div
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: and in article.

chunks.text: So this paragraph is not in div.

chunks.text: I will show you.

chunks.text: Now this property is not applied.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Because this selector means
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: if it is directly in div,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: then what will happen?
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: This selector will be applied.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Here this direct child is not there.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: In div, there is article and then p.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: This is not the direct child of div.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: But if I want
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: that if paragraph
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: is a descendant of any div,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: then this property is applied.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Then what will I do?

chunks.text: I will say

chunks.text: I will use descendant selector.

chunks.text: What is descendant selector?
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Descendant selector is
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: something like this.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I will write div,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: space and p.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: I am saying that p should be in div.

chunks.text: No matter what it is.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Whether it is in div, article, main,
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: footer.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: It should be in some form.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: It should be descendant of div.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: Now you can see
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: that this property is applied.
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: But when I talk about child selector,

chunks.text: then child selector should be
chunks.title: CSS Selectors MasterClass

chunks.text: direct child.

chunks.text: I hope you are getting it.

chunks.text: Now there is another one. Universal selector.
